title: Global white text across the React app via Tailwind foreground tokens

requirements.summary: Make `text-foreground` resolve to pure white in both light and dark modes via Tailwind CSS variable tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages (Home, About, Programs, Caf√©, Membership, Contact) render default body text in white without requiring per-component changes.
In both light and dark mode, `body` continues to use `@apply ... text-foreground`, and the resolved `foreground` color is white.
No regressions to layout/spacing occur as a result of the color token changes.

file_operations.description: Update the global theme CSS variables so `--foreground` is pure white in both `:root` (light) and `.dark` (dark), ensuring `text-foreground` renders white while `body` still uses `@apply bg-background text-foreground`.

requirements.summary: Ensure all user-visible text stays white even where explicit non-white Tailwind text utilities and interactive states are currently used.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation labels in the header remain white in normal, active, and hover states.
Footer link text and footer meta text remain white in normal and hover states, and icons/text that were previously yellow accent (e.g., `text-primary`) are updated to white.
Text in CTA areas (buttons, banners, forms) remains white unless the text is part of a non-text graphic (e.g., an image).

file_operations.description: Adjust supporting color tokens and custom utility mappings so common text variants remain white (e.g., set `--muted-foreground` to white and remap custom `.text-green-accent` / `.text-gold` utilities to use the foreground token), including preserving white selection text.

Update header navigation button classes so labels remain white in normal/active/hover states (e.g., replace `hover:text-primary` behavior with a white/foreground-consistent hover state while keeping existing layout/spacing).

Update footer text/link/icon classes so all footer copy stays white in normal and hover states (replace uses of `text-muted-foreground`, `hover:text-primary`, and `text-primary` on inline icon/link text with white/foreground-consistent classes).

Update Home page explicit non-white text utilities so user-visible text (including highlighted words and CTA button labels currently using accent or black text) renders white, while keeping existing backgrounds/branding and layout intact.
Update LeadForm success/CTA/help text classes so any explicit `text-muted-foreground`/accent text stays white (including informational and helper copy), without altering form layout/spacing.
Ensure StickyMobileCTA button and outline/hover text classes remain white in default and interactive states (hover/focus), without changing button backgrounds or spacing.

requirements.summary: Apply the white-foreground token update consistently across all active global stylesheet entrypoints used by the frontend build to avoid environment-dependent mismatches.
acceptanceCriteria: The app renders white text consistently in local dev and production builds.
There is a single, consistent source of truth for the white foreground token across global CSS files used by the build.

file_operations.description: Align the legacy/global CSS variable tokens with the active app theme so `text-foreground` resolves to pure white in both light and dark modes, avoiding dev/prod mismatches if this stylesheet is still included in any build path.

Confirm the canonical token definitions (including pure-white `--foreground`) are present and consistent in the primary stylesheet imported by the app, and document/organize variables to serve as the single source of truth across global CSS entrypoints.
